page.title: 18BLEAZE HALL.
page.content: { Bleaze Hall}is approximately four miles from{Kendal}on the road to {Kirkby Lonsdale.}Originally it was a farm but is now a private residence. An extension built by{Roger Boatman}in 1603 converted the existing rectangular shaped Hall into an 'H' shape. However much of the building was destroyed in the fire of 1840 leaving only the middle of the 'H' and one side still standing. The present owner has unblocked a number of windows that were bricked up some years ago, and in other parts of the house has added an extra level of floorboards to cover old ones which have been damaged by woodworm. He keeps a number of rabbits, hens and ducks outside. Legend has it that the Hall is haunted and that the{ghost}of a maiden roams its corridors.
